36#include "krb5_locl.h"
37
38/**
39 * Set the absolute time that the caller knows the kdc has so the
40 * kerberos library can calculate the relative diffrence beteen the
41 * KDC time and local system time.
42 *
43 * @param context Keberos 5 context.
44 * @param sec The applications new of "now" in seconds
45 * @param usec The applications new of "now" in micro seconds
46
47 * @return Kerberos 5 error code, see krb5_get_error_message().
48 *
49 * @ingroup krb5
50 */
51
52KRB5_LIB_FUNCTION krb5_error_code KRB5_LIB_CALL
53krb5_set_real_time (krb5_context context,
54 krb5_timestamp sec,
55 int32_t usec)
56{
57 struct timeval tv;
58
59 gettimeofday(&tv, NULL);
60
61 context->kdc_sec_offset = sec - tv.tv_sec;
62
63 /**
64 * If the caller passes in a negative usec, its assumed to be
65 * unknown and the function will use the current time usec.
66 */
67 if (usec >= 0) {
68 context->kdc_usec_offset = usec - tv.tv_usec;
69
70 if (context->kdc_usec_offset < 0) {
71 context->kdc_sec_offset--;
72 context->kdc_usec_offset += 1000000;
73 }
74 } else
75 context->kdc_usec_offset = tv.tv_usec;
76
77 return 0;
78}
79
80/*
81 * return ``corrected'' time in `timeret'.
82 */
83
84KRB5_LIB_FUNCTION krb5_error_code KRB5_LIB_CALL
85krb5_timeofday (krb5_context context,
86 krb5_timestamp *timeret)
87{
88 *timeret = time(NULL) + context->kdc_sec_offset;
89 return 0;
90}
91
92/*
93 * like gettimeofday but with time correction to the KDC
94 */
95
96KRB5_LIB_FUNCTION krb5_error_code KRB5_LIB_CALL
97krb5_us_timeofday (krb5_context context,
98 krb5_timestamp *sec,
99 int32_t *usec)
100{
101 struct timeval tv;
102
103 gettimeofday (&tv, NULL);
104
105 *sec = tv.tv_sec + context->kdc_sec_offset;
106 *usec = tv.tv_usec; /* XXX */
107 return 0;
108}
109
110KRB5_LIB_FUNCTION krb5_error_code KRB5_LIB_CALL
111krb5_format_time(krb5_context context, time_t t,
112 char *s, size_t len, krb5_boolean include_time)
113{
114 struct tm *tm;
115 if(context->log_utc)
116 tm = gmtime (&t);
117 else
118 tm = localtime(&t);
119 if(tm == NULL ||
120 strftime(s, len, include_time ? context->time_fmt : context->date_fmt, tm) == 0)
121 snprintf(s, len, "%ld", (long)t);
122 return 0;
123}
124
125KRB5_LIB_FUNCTION krb5_error_code KRB5_LIB_CALL
126krb5_string_to_deltat(const char *string, krb5_deltat *deltat)
127{
128 if((*deltat = parse_time(string, "s")) == -1)
129 return KRB5_DELTAT_BADFORMAT;
130 return 0;
131}
